Posts.Content: Mar 23, 2011 04:54AM adangel wrote: Hi Tinaj, Your situation seems so similar to mine.  I also had a non-palpable tumour that was found using a digital mammogram - like your story, no one could feel it, even knowing were it was.  I also needed the needle localisation technique before the lumpectomy, along with a wire insert.  Apparently, my left breast is extremely dense (personally, I find that a bit unfair).  The doc even had trouble getting the wire in - I think his exact comment was "your breast is too strong for my needle" - ha - that will teach you to call it dense! Like you, surgery produced a surprise DCIS of 1.3 cm to complement the 1.1 cm IDC - all hormone positive and her2 negative.  Thankfully all nodes were clear.  At that point, I thought I'd get away with rads and hormone.  But, had the oncotype test and scored 29 so now I'm doing chemo as well.  Started yesterday. How are you doing?
Posts.Title: CALLING ALL STAGE I SISTERS sheila888 MCBaker

Posts.Content: Mar 27, 2011 02:13PM adangel wrote: Are there any other stage 1 sisters going through chemo?  Highish oncotype cx score put a kink in the plan.  Just finished first round of FEC chemo.  2 more to go and then 3 rounds of "T".  Feeling pretty ok - considering...
Posts.Title: CALLING ALL STAGE I SISTERS sheila888 MCBaker
